titleStmt.title: መልክአ፡ አርባዕቱ፡ እንስሳ፡
Image of the Four Living Creatures

respStmt.resp: Manuscripts transcribed and encoded in TEI by
respStmt.name: Augustine Dickinson

respStmt.resp: Critical edition and translation based on discussions from the
respStmt.name: "ጉባኤ፡ አንባብያነ፡ መልክአ፡ ጉባኤ፡" reading group

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 license.

lg.l: እምዝክረ፡ ከዋክብት፡ አርባዕ፡ዐርባዕ፡ መዋዕለ፡መዋዕል፡ ዓመታት፡አመታት፡ ዘይሌልዩ፡እለ፡ ይሌልዩ፡ዘይሌሉ፡ዘይሔልዩ፡ይሌልዩ፡ዘይትሌለዩ፡እለ፡ ይትሌዩ፡
ለዝክረ፡ ስምክሙ፡ ቦቱ፡ውስተ፡ አፉየ፡ ከመ፡ ይሰንቀው፡እሰንቁ፡ትሰንቅው፡ይሰንቁ፡ይሰንቅዉ፡ይሰነቅው፡ ማኅልዩ፡ምኅላዩ፡መኃልዩ፡ምህላዩ፡
ሰላም፡ ለሥዕርተ፡ ርእስክሙ፡ለስእርተ፡ ርእስክሙ፡ለሥዕርትክሙ፡ለዝክረ፡ ስምክሙ፡ አርአያ፡ከመ፡ዘአርአያ፡አምሳለ፡ በረድ፡ ንጹሕ፡

app.rdg: ሰላም፡ ለገጽክሙ፡ ሕዝቅኤል፡ ርእዮ፡ዘርእዮ፡ ሕዝቅል፡ሕዝቅኤል፡ ዘርእዮ፡ በፄዋዌ፡በጼዋዌ፡በጺዋዌ፡

lg.l: እለ፡ ትጸውሩ፡ዘትጸውሩ፡እለ፡ ትፀውሩ፡እንዘ፡ ትጸውሩ፡ እንስሳ፡ኪሩቤል፡ኪሩብ፡ መንበረ፡ መንፈሳዌ፡
ሰላም፡ ለቀራንብቲክሙ፡ ርቡዓነ፡ ገጽ፡፬ኪሩባውያንርቡዐነ፡ ገጽ፡፬እ እንስሳ፡

app.lem: ገጸ፡ ላህም፡ዘላህም፡ዘአምሳለ፡ ላህም፡ መግዝዕ፡መግእዝዕ፡ ወገጸ፡ወበገጸ፡ ግሩም፡ አንበሳ፡
app.rdg: ገጸ፡ ላህም፡ ወንስር፡ንስር፡ ገጸ፡ ሰብእ፡ ወገጸ፡ አንበሳ፡ወአንበሳ፡እንስሳ፡
በአምሳለ፡ ላህም፡ ወሰብእ፡ ወንስር፡ ወዘገጸ፡ ግሩም፡ አንበሳ፡

lg.l: ንጉሠ፡ ይሁዳ፡ ሰሎሞን፡ ወመልአከ፡ ኤፍሬም፡መልአከ፡ ኤፍሬም፡ ዘደወለ፡ ምሕሳ፡ዘወለምሕሳ፡ዘወልደ፡ ምሕሳ፡ዘወለ፡ ምሕሳ፡
አግለፈ፡ገለፈ፡አግበረ፡ አምሳሊክሙ፡አምሳሌ፡ ቲክሙ፡ምስሌክሙ፡አርአያክሙ፡ ለቤተ፡ለእሙ፡ አምላኩ፡አምላክ፡ በከርሣ፡
ሰላም፡ ሰላም፡እብል፡ ለአዕይንቲክሙ፡ ዘታሕተ፡ ቀራንብት፡ ዘገጽ፡ወገጽ፡በገጽ፡
አኃወ፡እኅወ፡እኃው፡አሐወ፡ መባርቅት፡ ኪሩቤል፡አርባዕ፡ ወዘእለ፡ ቄጥሩ፡ወዘእለቄጥሩ፡ወዘኤልቄጥሩ፡ወዘእለ፡ ቂጥሩ፡ወዘእለ፡ ኬጥሩ፡ወዘኤሊቄጥሩ፡ አብያጽ፡
ለመንበረ፡ ንግሡ፡ለንጉሥ፡መንበረ፡ ንግሡ፡ ስቡሕ፡ስቡሐ፡ ዲበ፡ አክናፊክሙ፡ ለዘረበቦ፡ዘረበቦ፡ለዘ፡ ረበቦ፡
አቅርንተ፡ ቅዳሴ፡ ኪሩቤል፡አርባዕ፡ ወመሰናቅው፡ወበሰናቅው፡ ዘቃለ፡ዘቀርነ፡ለቃለ፡ የብቦ፡
አዝማደ፡አእማደ፡ መደንግፅ፡መደንግጽ፡ መብረቅ፡መባርቅት፡ኪሩብረቅ፡ ግሩመ፡ ወአኃወ፡ወእኅወ፡ወአሐወ፡ ጽዱል፡ፅዱል፡ ኮከብ፡
እምነ፡ መዓት፡ ይትራኅራኅ፡ ወይትየዋህ፡ይትረኃራኅ፡ይትየዋህ፡ ወይትራኅራይትራኅራኅ፡ይረኀርኀ፡ይትራራኅ፡ አብ፡
ቃለ፡ ማኅሌተ፡ስእለትየ፡ አፉየ፡ስምየ፡ በአፄንዎ፡በአጼንዎ፡ለአጼንዎ፡በዓጼንዮ፡ ከመ፡ ጢሰ፡ ዕጣን፡ አዕርጉ፡ዐዕርጉ፡
እምድምፀ፡እምቃለ፡ መጥቅዕ፡መብረቅ፡ መፍርህ፡በሊሕ፡ዘይባልሕ፡በሊህ፡ ወእምጕሕና፡ወእምጎሐ፡ወሕጉና፡ ፀዓዕ፡ፀአዕ፡ጸዓዕ፡ጸአዕ፡ መደንግፅ፡
እንስሳ፡ኪሩቤል፡ እሳት፡ ኪሩቤል፡ ፬ ርቡዓነ፡ርቡአነ፡ግሩማነ፡ ገጽ፡

app.rdg: ነፋሰ፡ ቅዳሴ፡ ይነፍሕ፡ ዘመንክር፡ ፆታ፡ ነገሩ፡

lg.l: ዕደወ፡ዕድወ፡እድወ፡እድዋንየ፡ ደም፡ በላዕሌየ፡ላዕሌየ፡ እመ፡ እኩየ፡እኪተ፡እኵየ፡ መከሩ
እንስሳ፡ኪሩቤል፡ እሳት፡ ኪሩቤል፡ አንቅዕተ፡ አኰቴት፡ስብሐት፡ ወውዳሴ፡

app.lem: እምገጸ፡አምገጸ፡ ሥንክሙ፡ስንክሙ፡ስምክሙ፡ሥዕልክሙ፡ ጽዱል፡ፅዱል፡ጽዕድው፡ በታኅማሰ፡በተአኅዎ፡በማኅቶተ፡በተማሕሰ፡ዘቶማስሰ፡ ብርሃን፡ ሥላሴ፡
app.rdg: ገጸ፡ ላህም፡ ወንስር፡ ገጸ፡ አንበሳ፡ ወገጸ፡ ብእሴ፡
እምገጸ፡ ስንክሙ፡ ፅዱል፡ በታሕማሰ፡ ብርሃን፡ ሥላሴ፡

lg.l: ሰላም፡ ለክሳውዲክሙ፡ለክሳድክሙ፡ለክሣድክሙ፡ መልዕልተ፡ መታክፍ፡መታክፍት፡ እለ፡ ይነብራ፡
እለ፡ ትገብሩ፡ትትራሰዩ፡ ኪሩቤል፡ ሞጣኅተ፡ሞጣሕተ፡መጥባሕተ፡ሞጠሕተ፡ በቀል፡መብረቅ፡መባርቅት፡ ዓፅፈ፡ዓጽፈ፡አጽፈ፡
ጸሎተ፡ጸሎትክሙ፡ ጽዮን፡ጽግዮን፡ ኅሪት፡ በጊዜ፡ጊዜ፡ ጸባኦት፡ፀባኦት፡ፀባዖት፡ጸባዖት፡ ተወክፈ፡
ሰረገላሁ፡ሰረገላቲሁ፡ሠረገላቲሁ፡ሰረገላ፡መናብርቲሁ፡ ኪሩቤል፡ ለዘይመልክ፡ለዘ፡ ይመልክ፡ለዘ፡ ይመልክ፡ዘይመልክ፡በዘ፡ ይመልዕ፡ለዘይመልዕ፡ ኵሎ፡
እንስሳ፡ አርባዕ፡ እለ፡ ትሰወጡ፡ ከመ፡ ባዚቃ፡
አፍጥኑ፡ ከመ፡ ትፈጽሙ፡ ጻሕቀ፡ ልብየ፡ ዘዘልፍ፡
ፈጽሞ፡ መፍቅዱ፡ ለልብ፡ ከመ፡ ይጽሕቅ፡ አፍ፡
አፍረሰ፡ እሳት፡ ኪሩቤል፡ ዘሀገረ፡ ሰማይ፡ መቅደስ፡
እምነ፡ እራኅ፡ ታሕተ፡ ወእምነ፡ ኵርናዕ፡ ላዕለ፡
በዓፀድ፡ ጸናፊ፡ ለባሴ፡ ቅድሳት፡ አመ፡ ቆመ፡
ለንጉሠ፡ ስብሐት፡ ኪሩቤል፡ እንተ፡ ኮንክሙ፡ አፍራሶ፡
እለ፡ ትረውጹ፡ ኪሩብ፡ ኀበ፡ አንጸረ፡ ቀዳማዊ፡
በንዋየ፡ ውሥጥክሙ፡ ተማኅፀንኩ፡ ከመ፡ ፍሬ፡ ጻማየ፡ ይስዊ፡
ሰላም፡ ለኅንብርትክሙ፡ ከመ፡ ዓይነ፡ ማኅተም፡ ዘተገልፈ፡
ሰላም፡ ለአቍያጺክሙ፡ ርስነ፡ ብርት፡ እለ፡ ይመስላ፡
ሰላም፡ ለአብራኪክሙ፡ ለስብሐተ፡ ልዑል፡ እለ፡ ይሰግዳ፡
እስመ፡ ኀበ፡ የሐውር፡ እግር፡ አሣዕን፡ ይተሉ፡
ሰላም፡ ለአጽፋረ፡ እግርክሙ፡ በጽንፈ፡ አፃብዕ፡ እለ፡ ተለብጡ፡
እምሀኬት፡ ውስተ፡ ተገብሮ፡ ግዕዘ፡ ዚአየ፡ ወልጡ፡
ገጸ፡ ላህም፡ ወንስር፡ ገጸ፡ ሰብእ፡ ወአንበሳ፡
Salutation to the commemoration of your names; their greatness is exalted
More than the memory of the four stars which separate the seasons of the years.
Four Creatures, bearers of the heaven of the Lord,
In order that I may sing a song for the memory of your name with it,

app.lem: Put a word of wisdom in my mouth.
app.rdg: Root out stuttering from my lips.

lg.l: Salutation to the hair of your heads; their appearance is like pure snow,
And the red colour of jacinthcf. Ez. 28:13-14.
Grant me, my lords, out of the multitude of your grace,
Comfort in the evening and mercy in the morning.

app.lem: Salutation to your heads; they are of another nature
app.rdg: Salutation to your head; it is not flesh

app.lem: Than the head of every fleshly thing.

lg.l: Four Cherubim, like the rivers of Paradise,

app.lem: I take refuge in your heads. Having arisen to heaven,
app.rdg: Having arisen to your faces, without anything else,

lg.l: May the word of my song return grace.

app.lem: Salutation to your faces. While he was in exile,
app.rdg: Salutation to your faces. Ezekiel saw in exile

app.lem: The prophet Ezekiel saw themEz. 1:1-27 with the eye of understanding.
app.rdg: Each one of your four faces.

lg.l: Creatures who carry the throne of the spiritual (kingdom),
Adorn my face with the adornment of your faces
So that I may resemble a bridegroom who has gone out from the bridal chambercf. Ps. 18:5.
Salutation to your eyelashes, four-faced Creatures,
The face of an ox and an eagle, the face of a man and the face of a lion.

Solomon, the King of Judah, and the messenger of Ephraim, of the region of MǝḥsaUnclear; also mentioned in stanza 14 of መልክአ፡ መስቀል፡ (ነቢያተ፡ ራእይ፡ ዘደወለ፡ ምሕሳ፡) and መጽሐፈ፡ ስንክሳር፡ for Ḫǝdār 6 (ክርስቶስ፡ ጐይየከ፡ እምደወለ፡ ምሕሳ፡),

Had your likeness engraved in the interior of the Temple of his GodThe image of the Four Living Creatures carved in the Temple of Solomon is the subject of one of the miracles of Jesus (PO 14.5, no. 14)
Once it was completed after thirty years.
Salutation, salutation to the eyes of your faces
Cherubim, siblings of lightning and companions of electrumcf. Ez. 1:4.
Your appearance upon the propitiatory (of the Ark),
Another year, after Egypt was destroyed,
Moses had made a cherub of wood.
Salutation to your ears, which are attentive to the utterance
From the throne of His glorified kingdom, which He established upon your wings.
Trumpets of praise, Cherubim, and lyres of joyful sound,
None of the angels, having found favour,
Salutation to your cheeks, which resemble (live) coals
And an awesome flash of lightning.
Creatures of fire, Cherubim, you who carry the highest (heaven),
Grant me, lords, the era of peace,
Its enumeration being incalculable or measurable.
Salutation to your nostrils, four-faced Cherubim,
Kinsmen of terrifying lightning and siblings of the bright star.
Lords, you are the banks of the river of glory;
When a word of supplication resounds from your mouths,

The Father is soothed and calmed from angercf. the Homily of Pseudo-John Chrysostom on the Four Living Creatures: "ወሶበ፡ ይስእልዎ፡ እሉ፡ አርባዕቱ፡ እንስሳ፡ ለአቡየ፡ ይሣሀሎሙ፡ ለውሉደ፡ ሰብእ፡ ወይሰሪ፡ ሎሙ፨" (BnF Éth d'Abb 54, f. 70r).
Salutation to your lips, which rejoice greatly
When they hallow and when they bless the Lord.
Four Living Creatures, clothed with lightning,
Grant me, lords, a small (portion) of your grace,
Having conceived righteousness, let me beget peace of life.
Salutation to your mouths, a pool for a river of praise
And a stream of the water of life.
The throne of the law of the Lord is carried upon you.
Make the song of my mouth arise with the savour of incense
And, Cherubim, cause my sins to be forgiven.
Salutation to your teeth, which are ardorned with light
For the consumption of food which they do not chew.
Four Living Creatures of the heavenly palace,
Your likeness was crafted, through the skill of the relative of AchsahUnclear; see Js. 15 and Jg. 1,
Upon the two supports of the Ark of the Lawcf. Ex. 25:18-20.
Salutation to your creation from wind and fire
On Sunday along with the heavens and the earth.
Creatures, you who sustain the throne of the Trinity upon (your) hand(s),
Grant that I may be a servant to you
So that I may stand nearby with your company.
Salutation to your tongue, intercessory and merciful,
Creatures, upon you is the chariot of the flying Spirit.
Protect my tongue from the hunting speaker of lies
As you protected the tree in Eden which bore fruit.
Salutation to your voice, which resounds greatly,
More than the sound of a sharp trumpet or the mystery of terrifying thunder.
Let my prayer rush to you
Like an arrow flying from a mighty bow.
Salutation to your breath, its colour is invisible
Four Creatures, bearers of the Lord's throne,
If men of blood conspire evil against me,
Let your breath spread flames upon them.
Salutation to your throat, which shouts holiness.
Creatures of fire, Cherubim, fountains of glorification and praise
From the face of your shining beauty, three in five lights
The queen of the night, BǝnāseThe third name of the moon; see Hen. 78:2, became dull.
Salutation to your necks, which sit atop your shoulders,
As they carry your head, the judge of flesh.
Your likenesses, before the cherubic army,
Bezalel, (son) of Hur, through the craft of weaving, reproduced
Upon the ten curtains of the TabernacleEx. 37:1-5,20 of old.
